snippet: The Mets agreed to a contract with Harvey for the 2016 season, avoiding arbitration. Harvey will reportedly make $4.325 million, about seven times more than he made last season.
abstract: New York Mets avoid arbitration with several players, including pitcher Matt Harvey, who agrees to one-year $4.325 million contract; other baseball news noted.
lead_paragraph: The Mets agreed to a contract with Harvey for the 2016 season, avoiding arbitration. Harvey will reportedly make $4.325 million, about seven times more than he made last season.
